Package Anomalias

Class Medicao

  • java.lang.Object
    • Anomalias.Medicao
  • public class Medicao
extends java.lang.Object
    Gets a Medicao from a single sensor, converts it to the correct time (Portugal's timezone) and check for Anomalias not related to variations - for example, checks if the valorMedicao is positive for some cases, if the date is valid, etc.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Medicao​(java.lang.String valorMedicao, java.lang.String tipoMedicao, java.lang.String dataHoraMedicao)
      Checks wether the program is ready to deal with the type of sensor that it came in, then checks the type of the data received - a Double, if the date is valid(according to the user's needs) and in some cases if it's positive or is different from certaint values allowed .

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      The data comes in as xx-xx-xx xx:xx:xx but without leading zeros.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Medicao

        public Medicao​(java.lang.String valorMedicao,
               java.lang.String tipoMedicao,
               java.lang.String dataHoraMedicao)
        Checks wether the program is ready to deal with the type of sensor that it came in, then checks the type of the data received - a Double, if the date is valid(according to the user's needs) and in some cases if it's positive or is different from certaint values allowed .
        Parameters:
        valorMedicao - Value from the medicao that might or not be valid
        tipoMedicao - Type of sensor used to read the value of the medicao; The type of sensor might be valid or not.
        dataHoraMedicao - The time and date from when the Medicao was taken according or not the timezone

      • dataHoraParaFormatoCerto

        public java.lang.String dataHoraParaFormatoCerto​(java.lang.String dataHoraMedicao)
        The data comes in as xx-xx-xx xx:xx:xx but without leading zeros. For example 1990-5-3 12:4:20 gets converted to 1990-05-03 12:04:20 Due to the sensor's hour being an hour behind, it also add it to the correct date(GMT +1 +1 again).
        Parameters:
        dataHoraMedicao - Date with leading zeros and not checked for its timezone
        Returns:
        Date without leading zeros and in the correct timezone
